applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the document for several key reasons: 1) The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document that outlines the operation of an occupational pension scheme, not an intermediary service agreement. 2) The document does not discuss any intermediary fees, commissions, or payment options - it only discusses employer-paid premiums (Section 2.3 states 'The employer will pay all premiums under any policy'). 3) The scheme is established directly between the employer, trustee, and AIB Life as the life office/registered administrator - there is no intermediary involvement mentioned in the document. 4) The document focuses on defining scheme rules, benefits, trustee duties, and administrative procedures rather than any fee or commission arrangements. The regulation specifically addresses intermediary fee disclosures, which are not relevant to this type of pension scheme documentation.
regulation_title: Fees - option of payment, amount, and commission offset, to be explained by intermediaries
regulation_text: 33. (1) Where for the purposes of payment of an intermediary for its services, the intermediary allows a consumer the option to pay for its services by means of a fee, the option of payment by fee and the amount of the fee shall be explained in advance to the cons umer. (2) If an intermediary charges a fee and also receives commission in respect of a financial service provided to a consumer, the intermediary shall specifically explain to the consumer whether or not the commission will be offset against the fee, either in part or in full in advance of any such fee being charged. Chapter 3 Consumers in vulnerable circumstances
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
